name: The Quad Resort and Casino

reviews.title: What a dump
reviews.text: I would not recommend the Imperial Palace. The entire hotel is dingy, dreary, and depressing. In order to get to the rooms you have to pass through the smoke-filled casino. We only had one meal in the hotel - the breakfast buffet. It was cheap and very low quality. Would recommend the breakfast at Cravings at the Mirage across the street. For a few dollars more, you get quality food in a pleasant environment. The entrance to the garage at Imperial Palace is very difficult to find. There is a problem with the hot water in the building. One day I could not get the water in the shower above tepid. Any colder and it would have been impossible to shower. I would not stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best advantage of this hotel is its location; it is right in the heart of the Strip. Everything you want to visit is kind of nearby. We had reserved the Casino Gold Special for one week. Special rate applied only to three nights out of seven. We stayed in room 1559. The view was not overwhelming but hey, we were there only late evenings and early mornings. Ventilation fans outside were not bothering if you kept the door closed. Our "deluxe" room was kind of plain but it was spotless and every basic necessities we needed were there. Room service was efficient and we got fresh towels everyday. We used the side set of elevators instead of the main ones and we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes. We ate at the hotel restaurant for one dinner and two breakfasts -- food is okay but the fact that you cannot see outside is kind of bothering. The casino in the lobby is noisy (especially when the performers are singing) and the place smells like an ashtray but, fortunately, this situation does not communicate to the floors. You should not miss the auto collection show -- I am not an automobile freak and I was impressed with the number of old models that were gathered there.
reviews.title: Great location, fair price

likes.disliked: — The smell of cigarette in the lobby and main floor

reviews.text: Where do I begin. This hotel was one of the worst places I have ever stayed. And I have been all over the world. Our tub did not drain. My bed was on a tilt. Their idea of an arcade had like four games. Everything was outdated. If you were on floor fourteen, sorry, because the elevator would not stop on that floor. The clientale was of lower class and I did not feel safe there. The only good thing that I can say is that the hotel is in a good central location and the staff were friendly. After we complained about our stay, we received free dinner vouchers. But I would never stay or recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: Spent a week in the ip early feb, spent a lot of time wandering between the bigger casino's but always ended up back at the ip. The staff in the hotel, dealers, cocktail waiteress where all freindly and helpfull to the dumb irish git, explaining the different games, rules and like.
reviews.title: the only casino with life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front block of the hotel looks like it could do with a bit of a facelift, but the rooms where clean and well kept, the room staff looked happy even when you disturbed their cleaning by going to bed in the late hours of the morning.
reviews.title: One of the BEST hotels in LAS VEGAS

reviews.text: A friend was given a comp stay of 2 nights at Imperial Palace and upon check-in, we were given a room on the 9th floor. The clerk mentioned that if we found it too loud we could come back and change rooms. Well, when we got to the room in the afternoon, it was incredibly loud with street noise and music from directly below the balcony. The balcony door didn't latch properly, but even if it did, the noise was still loud! The outdoor concert area at Harrah's is right below this room. The room itself was very cheap - cheap furniture, bed linens, horrible decor, cheap bathroom. I'd say it was like a Howard Johnson, but I'm not sure HoJo is that bad and don't want to insult them. Again, to the hotel's credit, the guy offered to move us to a quieter room, before we even saw the room, but we had a comp at another hotel also, and just stayed there instead. Would only stay here as last resort, or would at least investigate their "nicer" rooms.
reviews.title: Incredibly loud, low-quality room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night at the IP on the last trip at the end and recieved nice comp offers so we gave it a try this time.
reviews.title: Great time at the IP!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess I should start by saying we used to almost always stay downtown..majority of the time at the Fitz,
reviews.title: Disgusting! Don't Stay There!!!

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at Imperial Palace and had a great time!
reviews.title: Horrible!!!!!!

reviews.text: Check in was a small wait but not too bad..otherwise..seamless. Check out no problems or surprises.
reviews.title: Excellent location, best value hotel on the Strip

reviews.text: I am a gold card total rewards member and booked my deluxe love tub suite through the total rewards web site. It was free and I could not complain. the "Love Tub" was in the bedroom with mirrors over the tub and the bed. Large room, separate room with sink and then a small bathroom with another tub & shower and toilet and another sink. Large closet as well. All rooms at the IP have a balcony which I like.. Room was dated, but all in all clean. Location is amazing, Mcdonalds next door at harrahs & buffet at harrahs is great!
reviews.title: Imperial Palace has excellent Location with average rooms..

reviews.text: The IP is situated in a great location right in the centre of the strip.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Price Can't Argue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are also likely to find it available at a great price.
reviews.title: Perfect for a budget hotel...

reviews.text: It's a great hotel if you aren't expecting super luxury. You'll learn that in Vegas that you get what you pay for!
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had three rooms for the CES convention (140,000 descend on Vegas for 5 days) so it's actually busier than New Year.
reviews.title: Great Value, Clean Rooms, Excellent Location

likes.liked: — Clean Room, Great Location, Excellent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a comped Luv Tub Room via the Harrah's Website. Reservation system made it easy and got exactly what we asked for, king bed and non-smoking. The hotel check-in, bell desk, and key desk were all friendly and prompt. Elevators were not slow, but were crowded in the morning on the way down.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, old school but fun

reviews.text: The room was good sized. Plenty of room to run around. It seemed a little bare, like maybe a couch and coffee table were in there at one point and was replaced with a few chairs and a small table. Either way it was clean, had a one sink bathroom and the shower/tub was in the sleeping space, which we knew ahead of time. Mirrors on the ceiling above the bed and above the tub. There is a small balcony off the side of the room. It was not really useful except to gauge the temperature.
reviews.title: tired!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The improvements that could be made? The AC in the room is very under powered. When the temperature was cool at night it was great, but it was warm when we came back during the day. There was not much airflow in the room. A light switch to turn on the lights by the bed when you walk in the door would be nice, although a light in the hall gets you in with no problem. Hangers not attached to the rod would be a nice addition.
reviews.title: Probably wouldnt stay again
Decent place to stay
reviews.text: We only ate here once, breakfast/brunch at the Emperor's Buffet. It was ok but the food offerings were too mixed to make a decent lunch or breakfast. I knew going in it was a brunch, and if it were a bit later in the day I would have been happier with it. Oh I also got coffee at Betty's diner, they had some good looking pastries so that would be a good bet for light eats in the morning.

Gaming in the casino was fun. Standard fare slot machines and table games. Drink service was either great or MIA depending on the night. The outfits the waitresses wear are some of the most revealing in Vegas, so be ware if short skirts and low cut outfits offend you. The dealtainers are a fun addition, with decent performances.
reviews.title: Great place to stay but they closed the restaurants.

likes.liked: — The location in the middle of the Las Vegas strip.
likes.disliked: — I found the fact that most of the restaurants were closed or were no longer open 24 hrs.

reviews.text: I stayed here for five nights at the start of May for Boxing.The hotel is in the middle of the strip across from ceasers palace,great location.The atmosphere in the Imperial is great at the bars due to the working class clientele that stay here.You can have a drink and a laugh,it is no problem,great fun.The hotel is always busy which adds to the atmosphere.We had a strip view room which was great although the noise from carnival court is loud and lasts from 11am until 3 am so if you want peace make sure you dont get a strip view room.The pool is adequate.For a budget hotel with a great location choose the Imperial,we had a ball.The other hotels in Vegas are more classier,ceasers,mandalay,mgm,etc but have absolutely no atmosphere and are not worth the extra money...
reviews.title: Working class crowd with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid $50USD a night and you get what you pay for. The rooms are very dated and feel dirty and grimey. The casino attracts a pretty dodgy crowd. If I went again I would pay $100 USD and stay somewhere like the Venetian which was gorgeous. Was located in a good spot on the strip.
reviews.title: Pay a few more dollars and go somewhere nicer

reviews.text: Just returned from Las Vegas and stayed at the imperial palace, dont believe the poor reviews, the hotel couldnt be better located, its clean and got everything you need. Right in the middle of the strip, better located than MGM or Mandalay bay. The hotel has its own monorail stop which is so convienient but the deuce bus is better value and again stops right outside. The imperial palace may not be the poshest hotel but if you just need a value for money hotel in a fantastic location then dont look anywhere else.
reviews.title: Don't believe the bad reviews, its excellent !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in Monday night 05/04, staff was friendly. Our room on the 13th floor at first seemed ok, but I noticed a partially used complimentary shampoo left on the tub shelf by the previous occupants. Then a moth died in front of the patio door and it was STILL
reviews.title: OK, but..........

reviews.text: THERE on Friday morning 05/08 when we checked out, I of course assume the room was not vacuumed properly or at all. Then on Friday morning as we were packing up I noticed a blood spot on the bedspread. Didn't see that prior, or I would have brought it
reviews.title: Stay There All The Time

reviews.text: We only had 2 days and needed to be close to the strip to avoid the traffic hassle. The Imperial Palace was the cheapest online one on the Strip, so we chose to go there (being a Thursday) instead of booking online to check it out first. Big mistake...we paid significantly more by checking in at the hotel desk. Lesson learned! We had a teenager and an 8 year old with us. Were just a bit leary given some of the reviews here, but we found the hotel rooms to be VERY clean and comfortable. The hotel floors were surprisingly quiet (rooms as well). Yes, it is older, but not everything can be brand new, especially at this price! The desk attendants were nice, but the Concierge was extremely RUDE. She was the most non-helpful person I've ever encountered at a hotel concierge. Just shoved a bunch of papers at us and said "here are the kid oriented things, and transportation pamphlets...read 'em yourself" We got lots more help from people standing in line to buy tickets from her...they said she didn't have alot of info!
reviews.title: OK for a quick stay

likes.liked: — location, price, room cleanliness, monorail station
likes.disliked: — concierge, difficult layout, no travelers discount,

reviews.text: The hotel is quite confusing to navigate. And the comments on here regarding the elevators being slow are correct. But...we told the front desk attendant that we had read that online and she said she would put us in the best part of the hotel that could quickly access the back elevators (which are hard to find) near the parking garage.
reviews.title: Not Bad, Could Be Worse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Self parking is free!!...and we waited no longer than a minute for any back elevator....unlike other guests who we saw wait at main elevators a looooooong time!
reviews.title: Great - you get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Betty's Diner (in house) is the cheapest coffee and breakfast items since no continental is offered.
reviews.title: average
Good Value - Fun Casino, good spa
reviews.text: Location is really good being central on the Strip. The Monorail is convenient if your room is in the back of the hotel.

The updated rooms aren't bad but the service at Imperial Palace hotel staff is poor. They messed up my reservation by showing I checked out a day early and then rebooked my room to someone else. I came back to the hotel to find someone sitting in my room waiting for their friends to got their room rebooked. I'm just glad everything in my room wasn't stolen. They offered a $40 dinner but that didn't even cover the food and liquor in my room I had to throw out.. It is in a very good location on the strip though.
reviews.title: Don't Bother Unless You Just Want Cheap!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Imperial Palace from April 26th thru 30th. This was our second stay at the Imperial Palace and would definately come back. Room was clean, staff very courteous and helpful. Asked for a room with a vier of the Strip and was advised that it would be noisey. Appreciated this information but said that wouldn't bother us and were given a room on the 16th floor with a view. The only thing was that the 16th floor is where the Imperial Palace sign was so view was limited. Previous stay we were on the 13th floor and view was much better.
reviews.title: Second stay at Imperial palace and would stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do however think that there could be a better choice of eating places at the Imperial Palace. Because of the limited choices we chose to eat elsewhere. Did enjoy breakfast at the Tea House.
reviews.title: Old run down hotel in a good location!

reviews.text: Whenever in Las Vegas will make the Imperial Palace our choice of a place to stay.
reviews.title: I was surprized....it really was OK

reviews.text: I wish I would have started here before making reservations. The hotel was old 20 years ago when I stayed there and I don't think anything has been done since. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay and you are doing everything elsewhere, then you may not mind staying if old and slow doesn't bother you.
reviews.title: The Motel 6 of Vegas Strip Hotels

reviews.text: We booked through a timeshare vendor, so the room was free. This place is centrally located on the strip, the gaming is great, the entertainment is good. The hotel is definitely in a declining state, but you cannot beat the low prices and the location. It has a Monorail station, so you can leave your cheap room and head off quickly to any other place you want to go, or you could just walk. We didn't try the food there, because we ate at the FLAVORS Buffet at Harrah's next door, which was great! I heard a rumor and then confirmed with front desk, there are plans to tear it down and totally rebuild NEW! No one has seen the plans yet or knows the date, but personally I cant wait until they finish. Oh yeah and the people who work there are the NICEST people you can meet! Check in was slow, baggage storage was a long line, but we tolerated a lot because our stay was free! I was also able to find some very loose slots there!! Yay!! The room we had had no view, just looked out over the parking garage area, the elevators were actually pretty timely, most of the time. The Buger Place serves the best burgers and onion rings! Yummy!!
reviews.title: It is what it is!

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Imperial Palace for three years in a row. It is affordable and not too big. Also, the IP is in the center strip and on the monorail, so it is conveinent for fun and my annual convention.
reviews.title: Has Gone Downhill

likes.disliked: — How run down the property has become over the last few years.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will not stay at the IP again. My room was incredibly dirty and never properly cleaned. The shower had mold growing in it and even when I mentioned it to housekeeping, it was never properly cleaned.
reviews.title: Never Again!

reviews.text: There were good parts to my stay. The new spa is rather nice and and a one day pass is included in the online "Casino Gold" package. Check-in was smooth and fairly quick (10 minutes).
reviews.title: Exactly what I expected for the price.

likes.disliked: — Not the cleanest place to stay while in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property has just gone too far downhill for me to return. I don't feel that the property is being kept up properly. The property's deterioration was even noticible in my converstations with staff at the business center. I can put up with a lot, but the IP has become too gross for me to return until they clean it up.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms at the Imperial Palace are supposed to be refurbished. Don't believe it. I've stayed at many hotels on the Strip and this is by far the worst. The room we stayed in was in very poor condition. There was no view, but our room did have a better view than those with windows that were eye-level with the walkway from the garage. Creepy! Speaking of the parking garage, self parking is horrendous - there are no directions to get into the hotel. When exiting the hotel to enter the Strip you must walk directly into incoming and outgoing traffic from the parking garage and cab lines. The only good thing about this hotel is the Dealertainers in the casino. They're very entertaining.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here!!

reviews.text: IP was dark, crowded and dreadful. We booked a deluxe room with two queen beds, but found nothing "deluxe" about the room (in fact, the interior looks and feels like a motel). The television set was from the mid-1990's, the toilet doesn't even have a cover (I didn't know they make toilets like that), and the towels were piled up like discarded garments. The AC was right next to the bed and roars like an engine. There is always a long wait for the elevator--on the day we left the hotel, it took us 15 minutes to get an elevator with enough room for us and our luggage.
reviews.title: Great location but dreadful accommodation

reviews.text: I am practical when I travel just need a clean place to sleep in a good location. The Imperial covers that without a doubt. Their website has the best deals. I suggest if a seat sale is going on open up the flight booking page. Then have the Imperial site open. Try to line up the lowest price for each site. The hotel can be had for as low as $60 a night. Flights well depends where you are coming from. Also they have a package that comes with all sorts of free stuff. (Meals, show discounts....) This is a great place for students and young people on a budget. You will be out of the hotel at all the other attractions the whole day it is a decent place to come back to.
reviews.title: Deal or No Deal

likes.liked: — Quiet, Clean, Price, Gold package came with free meals and discounts.

reviews.text: Tips:
reviews.title: good for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Faster Elevators behind the original 4. If you are at the back of the hotel there are more fast elevators.
reviews.title: You could do worse!

reviews.text: This hotel is located in an ideal location right in the heart of the Vegas strip (opposite Ceaser's Palace). It's true that the rooms are a little dated and worn, however during my stay they were cleaned every day to a good standard. This may not be the best place to stay if you're having a romantic getaway with your partner, but is an ideal place to come if you're in a group of friends wanting to make the most of the Vegas nightlife.
reviews.title: Great value for money - ideal location

reviews.text: This is certainly not a luxury hotel however my overall rating reflects the value for money that I think this place offers.
reviews.title: What a dump!!

reviews.text: This is probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. It is one step above prison. The hotel is old and rundown. The décor is really outdated. It was probably considered fashionable when it opened about 50 years ago. The hotel a damp, smell to it. And to make it worst, the tub did not drain when showering. So while taking a shower you have water up to your ankles. The beds were pretty uncomfortable too.
reviews.title: Bargain rate for Outstanding location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only positive was the location, Its right in the middle of the strip. The front desk staff was pleasant as well.
reviews.title: What at terrible experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only people who should stay here are the 25 and under crowd who just needs somewhere to store there luggage while our partying.
reviews.title: Great experience
Surprisingly nice for a low priced hotel
reviews.text: I stayed in one of the deluxe rooms on the 17th floor in June 2007 for $49 a night. I was hesitant to stay in a lower priced hotel especially after reading some reviews on this site but I would definitely stay there again. It was much nicer than I had expected. The room was very attractive and very clean. The location (center strip) makes it an even more attractive deal.

reviews.title: Less than Optimal
reviews.text: The Imperial Palace was a good buy and surprisingly nice.

We were in a deluxe renovated room; and had the small standard tv not the bigger one which was showed in virtual tours thats on the website; again the problem with the elevators that everyone is complaining about; to long a wait and one was actually broken down for over a day making a difficult situation worse
reviews.title: Perfect Location on the Strip

reviews.text: This is a nice place to stay on the strip with pretty reasonable room rates. Check in was very quick. We got in about 1:30 and we were able to check in right away. The newly remodeled rooms were nice. The room I had was on the 15th floor right next to the elevators but the noise was never a problem. The beds were comfortable. Showers were good. Rooms were clean. We ate at the buffet a couple of times for breakfast and lunch. The food selection is very good. The price is excellent for buffets in Vegas now. Sign up for a players card and take advantage of the coupons that they give for the buffets and attractions. There is a Car museum which I didn't go to this time but I was there in April and it is definitely worth seeing. Most times you can get coupons to go in for free.
reviews.title: AVOID the polynesian poolside luau

likes.disliked: — slow elevators, old hotel, luau sucked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gambling was good. The slots were not too bad for payout. Not like downtown on Freemont Street, but not bad for the strip where everything seems to cost more.
reviews.title: Great Location-Cheap Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights from April 25 through April 28. When I checked in , I announced that I would be writing a review on TripAdvisor and preferred a quiet room on a higher floor. I got Room 16128 on the 16th floor at the back of the hotel. There was no great view-parking lots and backs of buildings but NO NOISE. I felt for the people who were staying at the front of the hotel, especially the ones on lower floors, because there was a lot of noise on the strip. The room looked like a 1970's Holiday Inn room. There were 2 double beds, a good tv with local channels and a few cable channels (ESPN etc), a table with chairs. The a/c worked fine. There was no safe-a big negative that should be updated. The bathroom was standard with tub/shower combo and a clean sink area. There were basic amenities such as shampoo and soap. The ice bucket was there also, and free ice was available near the elevators, about 100 feet away. Sometimes there were drunk people in the hallway, but that could occur anywhere. The elevators were slow as everybody states, but I never had to wait more than 2 minutes. There was usually entertainment from the drunk guests but nothing violent or offensive. The location was fantastic and was convenient to everything. I had breakfast in the restaurant on the 2nd floor. It was not the best but was comped based on my Total Rewards-a definite must for anyone staying at a Harrah's property. I had stayed at the Paris last December and had been receiving offers ever since so I decided to return, but the only available place with a comp room was the Imperial Palace so that's where I stayed-so great for the price (free). I also had received a coupon for 2 free buffets at the Rio so I took the free shuttle bus there for a fantastic buffet with something for everybody. The free shuttles leave from the Paris or Harrahs next door. They also give you a coupon book at check in so I got my free Flamingos and Harrahs tee shirts after about 20 minutes on the slots. There was also a discount coupon for the prime rib/Chinese place at Bill's, but I didn't realize I had one until I ate there the first night an did not have a chance to return. The casino wasn't as smoky as I was expecting, and I had fun playing the slots and drinking free beers. I lost a few hundred but had a great time. I am planning another trip in the fall and hope to stay at another Harrah's property so I can continue to sample them all. Good luck to all!
reviews.title: Not as Bad as I was expecting

reviews.text: I loved this hotel, it was recomended to me by a good friend so I knew it would be ok, but after seeing some reviews I didn't have high expectations. I was pleasently surprised when we turned up, we had a room on the 7th floor at the back with a view of the mountains, it was very quiet at night. The location of this hotel is just spot on, right in the middle of thr strip, opposite Ceaser's Palace - last time I stayed in the Excalibur and it was just too far away from all the buzz of the Strip. It's an old school Hotel, with a dated Casino but I thought it just added to the experience of being in Vegas - take the old with the new I say and just enjoy the whole experience. The Casino has a Celebrity look-a-like pit and they have the best Elvis I've ever seen, and Freddie Murcury was excellent as well. The pool was good and the frozen cocktails were delishious.
reviews.title: Perfect location, great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 10 out of 10 - will recomend this hotel to everyone I know who is going to Vegas.
reviews.title: can't beat this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed may 4-6. Asked if we could be upgraded at check in and was given a nice suite on 18th floor. All the staff was very friendly and nice. The bed was very comfortable and the pressure in the shower is great. You can't beat this place for the value and great location. Thank you to everyone at IP.
reviews.title: great location & value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow!, after reading some reviews about this hotel I was really impressed by what we found when we arrived. Some people wrote bad reviews but this is definately not one of them. Overall the hotel is a very nice place to stay for the money. For its age, the place is in very good condition and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The casino floor is always rocking and the slots are fair. The view of the strip from the 14th floor at night was stunning. Our room overlooked the carnival tent and listening to the bands play were a great way to wind down late at night. Sure, a lot of people would like to have a nice quiet place to sleep, but this is Las Vegas. Unfortunately we did not get to eat at all the dining spots, but the Burger Palace does a great burger and the beer is always ice cold. The only bad thing about our trip was a minor problem with some elevators. Other than that, I would definately recommend Imperial Palace as a good hotel to stay in. Dennis Lewis
reviews.title: Not bad at all.

reviews.text: Imperial Palace used to show its age much more, but having stayed there a dozen-plus times I can tell you the remodeled rooms are quite nice. Keep in mind, if you're booking Imperial you're doing so because it's a budget property, but based on that criteria, you'll be hard-pressed to find a nicer budget hotel anywhere. I've tried Stratosphere, Downtown, flamingo, Excalibur and other low-rent properties, and nothing tops Imperial Palace. There's something about having your blackjack cards dealt to you by Alice Cooper, Madonna, Prince or Cher that puts a smile on your face. If you go in expecting a big-casino operation, you'll be disappointed. But nighly Karaoke, fun atmosphere, a fair selection of restaurant choices, and a truly fun rock 'n roll casino make this feel more like a Carnival cruise than a Vegas setting. Right across the street from Caesar's Palace in the heart of The Strip, it's right where you want to be, at a price 75% below the big boys. Count me in, Baby!
reviews.title: Best value for location and FUN!
Worst hotel on the strip
reviews.text: We stayed at Imperial Palace and did not like anything about it. First off when we go to check in there was a long line with only 2 people working at the counter. Once it was finally our turn, we were surprized to find out that there was a $120 security deposit, leaving us with less spending money for the week. DO NOT EAT AT BURGER PALACE!!!!!!!!!! McDonalds is a 5 star restraunt compared to that. We tried the Emporers Buffet, not horrible for the price. The casino, pool, and restraunts are rather boring compared to all the other hotels. The rooms are old and somewhat drity. My feet were BLACK just from walking in our room. No exaderation but it took nearly 15 minutes just to get from the front of the hotel to our room. The hallways are so long and windly its a maze to find anyting in that hotel. Took almost an hour just to find our room when we checked in. We had 6 people staying there between 3 rooms. All 6 keys simutaniously stopped working. Leaving us to walk a mile to the front desk to get a working one, to walk a mile back to the room. Spend a few extra bucks to get a nicer hotel it would be worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 4-day, 3-night stay at the Imperial Palace. Based on recent reviews, I was very worried about what the casino and rooms would be like and considered booking elsewhere. I'm very glad I saved my money and stuck with the IP. Was this the best place I've ever stayed, no, it wasn't, but it also wasn't the worst. You get what you pay for! Our room was basic but the bed was comfortable and even for a smoking room, it wasn't bad. The bathroom was fine and the housekeeping staff did a great job of keeping you stocked with plenty of towels. The casino floor isn't the best but you are so close to other casino's (we like O'Sheas and Casino Royale for the cheap drinks) that it wasn't a problem. The pool was fine. Plenty of lounge chairs. Try a Miami Vice drink poolside. Very tasty. Will we stay here the next time we come to Vegas, probably not but we never stay the same place twice. We will stay with a Harrah property.
reviews.title: Don't let the poor reviews keep you from saving a ton of money by staying here

reviews.text: just back from vegas and could not say a bad thing about this hotel the rooms are large and cleaned every day . would stay here again with no hesitation .
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: You're more likely to hit the jackpot on Vegas' slots than get a decent room at the Imperial.
reviews.title: I'm in peril Hotel

reviews.text: It's in a prime location but is so run-down it's surely an embarrassment to the nearby hotels. The rooms are poorly equiped, the decor is beaten-up '70's tack: and the whole place has that stale smell of cigarettes and cheap alcohol.
reviews.title: Dont gamble at the Imperial Palace

reviews.text: If you really want to get rid of your hard earned cash at least have some fun on another casino's tables because a dollar spent here is a total waste.
reviews.title: Great location... poor hotel

reviews.text: We thought the hotel staff was friendly - but, the casino staff were the worst ever. Gambling on machines seems normal but table games were a bad experience due to very weird circumstances ie playing craps and two different numbers being marked on the same table, and playing games and not being payed, without argument or asking to see the tapes. Pit bosses like mob members not able to explain why money was handled poorly just quick to say , well you dont like it then leave. We not only wouldn't stay there again we wont even walk though.
reviews.title: WORST STAY EVER/ BATES MOTEL
Lost It's charm
reviews.text: This is the second time I have stayed at the Imperial Palace. The first time was just the poker buddies. We were going to play poker all night at the other casinos since its right in the middle of the strip close to Bellagio, Caesars, Mirage, and the Venitian. We knew from the reviews the hotel sucked but since we were only sleeping there we were okay with it. Hotel is old. Rooms are old.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Imperial Palace for three days, March 2 to 4, 2007.
reviews.title: This hotel is Legendary
Very Good
reviews.text: You are not getting spiffy new carpets with a fresh flower scent or a 5 star room. What you get is a perfect central location, that old Vegas hotel feeling with character, charm, and an atmosphere like no other. Loved every minute of it. Some staff were rude, some were great but thats all part of the experience that we love. Most of the "other" hotels lack the character that Imperial Palace has. They are all the same with a different facade. We will definately go back again...

We stayed at the Imperial Palace on 18th Feb until 21st Feb. When we arrived the queue to check in was silly. It took us 1 hour to check in even though they had about 6 members of staff on the desk. Apart from that, everything else was very good. The rooms were very clean and spacious. There have been a few complaints regarding the lifts on recent reviews but we never had a problem. The Bar Staff and Entertainers were spot on. We attended the legends show which was fantastic and I would full recommend going. We ate in the Hotel a couple of times, the food was good and reasonably priced, but there is better out there. We visited most the other Hotels and although they were Bigger, newer and had more attractions, Imperial had the best Casion atmostphere on the strip. Freemont Street is definitly worth seeing, more of a carnival atmostphere there and the laser show is incredible. The Free Pirate show at the Treasure Island is the best free show. The Must do attraction is the Helicopter ride to the Canyon. I was a little nervous before the flight, but it is spot on. I would definitly go back to Vegas and would stay at Imperial again if its still there.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A group of 12 met down in Vegas for a birthday party last weekend. I stayed at the IP in 2003 and probably wouldn't have stayed there again, but our rooms at the IP were booked by the couple planning the trip. The rooms had not seemed to change at all since I stayed there in 2003. They were small and outdated, yet clean and adequate for the amount of time we spent in our room. The price for the rooms on the weekend seemed a little high for the quality of room we had, but the location of the IP makes up for that.
reviews.title: Imperial Palace - Great Location

reviews.text: The prices also seemed high for the restaurants in the IP, so we just walked about a block down (just past Harrah’s) to a building that housed Chipotle, McDonalds, and pizza and Chinese fast food.
reviews.title: Hated it!!!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for about a week during a convention. The rooms were nothing special. However for the price of this hotel and the fact that it is right in the middle of the strip, it was exceptional value! Buffet food was pretty good and the karaoke lounge was a lot of fun. I would stay here again for some no frills accomodation in an excellent location.
reviews.title: Right in the thick of things

reviews.text: stayed there 2+ years ago..Had never been to Vegas, and the rates were good at a time Vegas is traditionaly busy...The hotel has an odor thruout,like it needs to knock down a wall and get some fresh air inside..The rooms are no better then a Super 8 motel that might be located in the middle of nowhere...The people lingering the casino around 7 am are people you don't want to be associated with,dregs of society..I guess if you had to choose between this hotel and say, the El Cortez,the location of the IP would make it the poor choice
reviews.title: Not very good

reviews.text: My stay at the hotel went well. It is a solid three star experience. Location on the strip is remarkable. If looking for a basic "nearly no frills" room then this is the place. Careful about the actual location of your room in the hotel. Initially my room overlooked an outside entertainment complex with a staggering amount of noise. I had to request a room change if I had any hope of sleeping. Hotel complied no problem. My room was very clean. No concerns whatsoever. The bathroom was spotless and the maid service was daily completed. Halls were clean with only an occasional amount of room service debris remaining. Can't understand why the hotel doesn't have someone steadily roaming the halls picking up the plates and etc. Seemed to be no security whatsoever upon entering the elevators. No room or pass key needed to get onto the elevators and up to the proper floor. Surprised early one morning to be followed to the elevator by a women looking to provide services quite aggressively. Yet, I guess it is Vegas! Did not drink or eat at the hotel. Can't comment in that regards. Casino is very smokey. Did not do much gambling there. Well, those are the basics of my stay.
reviews.title: Acceptable Three Star Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My daughter and i stayed at the IP hotel for 4 nites Jan. 22nd tru the 26th. With all of the varrying reviews i was not sure what to expect.
reviews.title: Clean and Acceptable

likes.disliked: — minimal security, thin walls & charging for boarding passes

reviews.text: I had a reservation for a basic room (2 double beds) so when my daughter and i checked in a asked for an upgrade and the man checking us in gave us a free upgrade to a room on the 12th floor with two queen beds. It was a very nice clean room. It was very nicely decorated and the bathroom had plenty of towels and the towels were not thin and they were extra long.
reviews.title: IP is FANTASTIC!

reviews.text: I stayed at Imperial Palace from Wed 6 May to Wed 13 May and managed to get a great deal online which worked out at less than $300 for 7 nights in a Deluxe Room.
reviews.title: Reasonable accommodation in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was on a Wed morning – I checked in 2 to 3 hours early which was no problem - there was around 20 mins wait for check in.
reviews.title: Do not stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The put me in a room with a view of the mountains (not the older Capri tower) – the advantages of this were that the noise levels were fine and I was close to the Monorail plus the back entry to Harrahs.
reviews.title: Will never stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apparently the rooms on the strip side get some loud noise from the night club until the early hours of the morning.
reviews.title: So Much Fun

reviews.text: The room itself was very basic and whilst everything was clean/comfortable it was definitely the most budget room I have had in all my visits to Vegas – although this is comparing to Bellagio/Signature at MGM/Planet Hollywood/Ballys/Excalibur.
reviews.title: Great Deal For Strip Location

reviews.text: We stayed here in September 2005, but wanted to pass on our experience. It was our first time in Vegas and we were thrilled with the location on the Strip. Forget about the 5 star hotel, this isn't it - what this is is a great, clean, comfortable tourist class hotel with an unbeatable location. You aren't going to spend much time in the room, you will be out sightseeing and exploring. The casino is easy to navigate, drinks are cheap (2 for 1 in happy hour) and the staff are helpful and friendly. Had a large room with a king bed, balcony and great views of the mountains.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location!

reviews.text: We are returning this year and have already booked into the Imperial Palace for our stay.
reviews.title: Lack of sufficient elevators will ruin your stay

likes.disliked: — Long waits for elevators and front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Heard that the car museum and Hawaaiian luau are good too, although we didn't try.
reviews.title: Great Location, Fantastic Value Hotel. Excellent

likes.liked: — Fresh clean room fantastic value for money and great location
likes.disliked: — decor in main casino is bit dated.

reviews.text: There are four elevators for all the rooms in this hotel. There are 2700 rooms. That's 675 rooms per elevator. The elevators are small; perhaps hold 8 people without luggage. Two - three people with luggage. You can NOT walk up the stairway, because the doors are locked from inside the stairwell. This led to extreme waits to go up or down the elevator day or night! We talked to some people who waited 20 minutes on the 8th floor to go down to check out (with luggage). They were in the stairwell with us banging & sliding thier luggage down the small staircase.
reviews.title: Love the IP - Great Room - but

likes.disliked: — It is dated and needs a facelift. Food quality of lunch and dinner buffets are apparently poor - something many guests seem to know about as they eat elsewhere

reviews.text: Upon arrival on a Thursday, it took us over 30 minutes to wait in the check in line --at 1 AM. The check out line Sunday morning was well over an hour. A "television check out" is advertised, but was not operable during our stay. You could view your bill, but there simply was NO option to do anything but view your bill. The check out person did not offer any apology or explanation; I suspect the "television check out" may be false advertising.
reviews.title: It ain't Caesars, but it doesn't pretend to be.

likes.liked: — Location, Location, Location and the friendly feel afforded by a smaller hotel.
likes.disliked: — Room telephone surcharge regardless of use and no room safe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to someones attention. Location is fabulous. Burger place not the greatest. Did not try the buffet. Too many timeshare people right near the elevator. And I would have liked
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: AMAZING Experience! I just came back from a 4 day trip to Vegas for a Bachelorette weekend. I stayed from 5/10-5/13, took advantage of their Casino Club promo on their website, had to call to get the rate. Thurs. night was 69.00, Fri & Sat. was 85.00. The promo provided the following: received an upgrade to a Deluxe Room/2 Double Beds; 2 coupons each for the free buffet (food, service and friendliness all perfect); free admin to the auto collection (didn't go, but coupon is good until Dec.); and some casino $ coupon. We had a room facing the pool, had a padio so you could get some fresh air. My other friends stayed at ExCalibur and paid over $100 per night for a standard room that was smaller than ours. Trust me when I say it's not worth it. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!!! IP places you right in the center of the strip and you have monorail access right at the hotel. Our stay could not of gone better. The only thing I recommend is allow yourself some time, the elevators are slow. Other than that, the pool and the hotel Luau dinner show is fantastic! Spend the $60.00 for the VIP seating...lots of food, lots to drink, a real flower lei, includes the tax & tip and much much more! You'll be pleased you did!!! We told them we had a Bride-to-be and they did something special for her during the show...it was great! This was my first time staying here, and WILL STAY HERE AGAIN & AGAIN!!! :)
reviews.title: Loved It!!!!

likes.liked: — Location & friendly staff...the price was a BIG BONUS too!

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Imperial Palace for 3 nights on a recent road trip when another friend got married in Vegas. Both of us had stayed in Vegas before (at Flamingos and Stratosphere) and this hotel did not match them really, it has a grimy kind of feel to it rather than the usual glamour of vegas.
reviews.title: Cheap and shabby but great location on the strip

likes.liked: — Great location in the centre of the strip

reviews.text: The room however, was fine - clean and large with a balcony, it was also very quiet and we had no problem sleeping, it was so quiet we were rather surprised given the central strip location but our room was right at the end of a corridor which could have been why. Our balcony overlooked the pool so from 10am every day there was music but other than this no noise.
reviews.title: Will be going back for Labor Day weekend!!!!

reviews.text: The location is what makes this a great base in Vegas, right next door to Harrah's and across from Ceasar's Palace, within a 10 minute walk to Fashion Show Mall, TI, Bellagio, The Venetian, Mirage and Paris Las Vegas. We didnt eat at any of the hotels own reataurants as when we checked out the menus we figured we could probably pay less for a nicer setting and we were right.
reviews.title: Wasn't bad at all!!

likes.disliked: — no coffee maker in the room!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not gamble in the casino here as it just felt kinda jaded and tacky and if you werent gambling the bars were pretty expensive. I would stay in this hotel again because it was great value for the location - but just dont expect much from the hotel in general.
reviews.title: Stay There!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I’ve never stayed at this hotel however, having seen the hallways and interior courtyard/pool area I can honestly say this hotel should be torn down FAST!. We always stay next door at Harrah’s. This property is owned by Harrah’s and I’ve read somewhere on the web it will be torn down at some point in the future. I have occasionally wandered into the casino section of the Imperial palace and thought it to be OK, a little kitschy. When looking for entertainment options close to Harrah’s we decided to try the Imperial Hawaiian Luau on 18AUG07. As the previous post stated it was dreadful. We stood inline starting at 6:30pm, the doors opened at 7pm and we left at 7:30pm. I purchased VIP tickets, we stood in line for the buffet, sat down, took a couple of bites and left.
reviews.title: Avoid the Imperial Hawaiian Luau and spend your $$ on quality entertainment.

likes.disliked: — As other posts have stated, the Imperial Hawaiian was dreadful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Imperial Hawaiian Luau pool scene was dreadful. The whole operation was mismanaged. The sound system was terrible and the food tasted like leftovers. While seated at the Luau you have hundreds of onlookers from the dreadful hotel room balconies above. Please avoid and spend your VIP $49.00pp on quality entertainment elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Imperial Palace because of its location and price. It is very true its dated and old. But it was well worth the price we paid. BE careful and make sure your not in the back building. If your in the casino building your fine. My friends had to stay in the back building that you had to walk through the underground parking garage to get to it.
reviews.title: Can you say, bait and switch
Good Value
reviews.text: The elevators are few and slow. The food was ok and the show was good. We were very lucky because we were in Vegas to get married and they upgraded our room when they found it out. It has a HUGE tub, but the tacky thing was the mirrored ceiling. YUCK.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was mid point on the strip so it was very convienent, it was right next door to Harrah's so you can take the shuttle to the Rio and the AWESOME carnival world buffet. There are better properties but they have higher prices. If you don't mind a Super 8 then book it. Its clean and friendly.
reviews.title: Just back from Vegas and the Imperial Palace :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the start and end of our 2 week road trip, ok the place is not the Bellagio but hey you get what you pay for. Regular room booked via internet on arrival no lines at check in, found the elevators just a short wait although you did have to fight past people on the casino floor, some of whom were so rude and pushy.
reviews.title: No probs you get what you pay for

reviews.text: The room - ok for what we paid, managed to see the sunrise so that was cool. On the 2nd stay on the way back though we had upgraded to a "Luv Tub" room, how cool was the bath, you could have had a party in it as for the mirrors on the ceiling above the bath and the bed, well cosmetic surgery required!
reviews.title: Surprisingly Good!!

reviews.text: We arrived early and chanced our arm at checking in only to be told we could register but could not have they keys till 3.30pm no problem went for a walk. The elevators can be a pain but we found if you headed for the car park and then went past the old check in area up the small escalators to level 2 turn left walk down the short hall round to the right there was another bank of 3 elevators, always empty and very short wait times.
reviews.title: Tired but good location!

reviews.text: The location is great, my biggest disappointment is that the casinos all seem to have got rid of coin machines, now where is the fun in putting in notes or even worse a card, yes I know they want to see the average spend, well mine was a big fat 0.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Autos collection was worth a visit especially of you like cars even better we had a coupon so it cost us nothing for a good hours entertainment.
reviews.title: The good, the bad, the ugly...

reviews.text: Stayed at IP for NBA all-star weekend. Did not like outdoor rooms because I'm a female and gamble late, request was made and relocated to hotel room on 1st floor. For the price we paid, I can't complain. Must say I only spent a total of 5-7 hours in room over 4-5 day period. We had a BALL. It was a high profile weekend, the biggest in Vegas history and I thought the town did well, so I'm glad I didn't spend any more money on a what one might call a 4 or 5 star hotel. Was able to walk to most of the major casinos, IP is in the BEST location. And the Rockhouse or Roadhouse club was always jumping. It was an average hotel among some fancier places so to compare it might not be fair, but it was always live and I must say, after watching the game at a bar in Excalibar(boring), this is where the fun and excitement was. If you want fun and remain economical, then IP is just fine. I used my funds for shopping, gambling, and events ($$'s) for the weekend. We also came away with a couple hundred from gambling as well as earned free meals and first night stay with comp dollars. If I had to make the choice all over again, it would be IP.
reviews.title: Had a Blast NBA All-Star Weekend!!
Absolutely Mediorce
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights in December of this past year, as a weekend escape with a friend. This marked my fourth trip to Sin City in the last 18 months. On the other trips I stayed at the Venetian, the Wynn, and at a friend's condo right outside Vegas in Henderson.

reviews.title: Great stay and location if you're on a budget!
reviews.text: The Imperial Palace is exactly what you expect and nothing more. It was a mediocre hotel (2 1/2 to 3 Star) with a great value (can almost always get a cheap room online) and a great location (middle the strip).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel if you were planning a weekend with friends, and looking to spend most of your time out and about in Vegas, and just looking for a place the sleep. The location allows you a great launching point to just about every and anywhere in Vegas. As the hotel is near other casinos with more modern facilities, you need not even worry about dining at the IP, because you will most likely be disappointed (bland, although cheap fare). Also, the hotel is very close to many of the smaller Vegas casinos (Fitzgerald’s and Casino Royale) which offer great low minimum tables and all day drink specials!
reviews.title: Center of Strip

likes.liked: — Location, clean & spacious room & sliding door opened--fresh air is nice
likes.disliked: — Drab casino, check-in line but check-out was superior

reviews.text: I would NOT go to this hotel is you wanted the more notable Vegas luxury experience (try Mandalay, the Venetian, or the Wynn). The hotel is one of the oldest on the strip, and lacks many of the more recently constructed hotel's glitz and appeal. The restaurants are no more impressive than any local town diner, and the pool can be compared to a local community swimming pool. The rooms are plain and boring, but are a great value considering the price and the hotels overall location on the strip.
reviews.title: Will miss it when it's gone...

reviews.text: The people staying at the hotel were a mixture of young and old. So I really couldn't say which age group was more dominant there. I also seen other reviews of people talking about a weird smell in the place. Neither my wife nor I noticed it.
reviews.title: location excellent

reviews.text: Overall the hotel was a great place for us to stay for our first trip to Vegas. Would I stay there again, the answer is yes!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: had a great stay at this hotel, its location is excellent for exploring all of the strip. only complaint dont get a room overlooking Harrahs as you will be kept awake till 2pm with the live music. rooms large, clean and comfy would recommend this as a budget hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing location

reviews.text: My sister and I take a vacation in Las Vegas every year but normally stay downtown. We decided to try staying on the strip for the first time this year. We had a great package deal for IP. The Imperial Palace is a great location. We were able to walk around and still go back to our room if needed. The hotel room condition was old but it was clean. The housekeeping staff was great. They always asked if we needed anything when passing them. I look forward to staying at IP again next year.
reviews.title: Old but comfortable in a great location.

aka: Imperial Palace Las Vegas Hotel Las Vegas
description: Stay and play at the center of the fun! Imperial Palace is known as home to great values in a great location. On the gaming floor, Celebrity-impersonator Dealertainers keep the excitement coming day and night. In the showroom, Smokey Robinson presents Australia’s Human Nature – The Ultimate Celebration of Motown. Audiences also rave about Frank Marino’s Divas Las Vegas and classic game show Name That Tune Live. Unbelievable portions of "Twisted Farm Food" rule at Hash House a Go Go and Mexican specialties sizzle at Quesadilla day and night. Other full-service dining options include Pizza Palace, Ginseng BBQ, the Emperors Buffet and Embers Steakhouse. Just steps from the casino floor, Fat Tuesday serves up tempting frozen concoctions and Rockhouse bar & nightclub adds lively entertainment to the mix. Of course, no trip to Imperial Palace would be complete without a visit to The Auto Collections, a unique exhibition of some of the finest and rarest automobiles in the country.
